summary: This document is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office personnel forwarding a draft opposition brief to Ghislaine Maxwell's motion to dismiss her indictment. The motion argues the indictment was improperly returned by a White Plains grand jury, and the correspondence includes attachments of the draft opposition and Maxwell's original motion.

events.title: Draft Opposition to Maxwell's Motion to Dismiss
events.description: A draft legal opposition is circulated for review in response to Ghislaine Maxwell's motion to dismiss her indictment on grounds related to the grand jury location.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell filed a motion to dismiss her indictment, arguing it was improperly returned by a White Plains grand jury.
The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York prepared a draft opposition to Maxwell's motion.
The email correspondence includes attachments of the draft opposition, a redlined version comparing it to prior briefing, and Maxwell's original motion.
The document references a legal argument concerning the Sixth Amendment in relation to the grand jury process.
All specific prosecutor names in the email are redacted, indicated by placeholders like '(USANYS)'.
